section.heading: Residential parking system in the city of Binghamton

content.p: Pine Street, from Carroll Street to Liberty Street;\n
Henry Street, from Carroll Street to Liberty Street;\n
Fayette Street, from Court Street to Henry Street;\n
Carroll Street, from Court Street to Henry Street; and\n

Liberty Street, from Court Street to Henry Street.
 3. Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, no permit
shall be required on streets where the adjacent properties are zoned for
commercial/retail use.
 4. The local law or ordinance providing for such residential parking
system shall:
set forth factors necessitating the enactment of such parking\nsystem; and\n

provide that motor vehicles registered pursuant to section four
hundred four-a of this chapter shall be exempt from any permit
requirement; and
provide the times of the day and days of the week during which\npermit requirements shall be in effect; and\n

make not less than twenty percent of all spaces within the permit
area available to non-residents and shall provide for short-term parking
of not less than ninety minutes in duration in such area; and
provide the schedule of fees to be paid for such permits; and\n

provide that such fees shall be credited to the general fund of
the city.
 5. No ordinance shall be adopted pursuant to this section until a
public hearing thereon has been had in the same manner as required for
public hearings on a local law pursuant to the municipal home rule law.
